q: to Be Rude, But..." in which he laid down five important principles that actors can use when auditioning. 1. Don't grovel when you come in. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. Believe in yourself the second you leave the house. "Self-possession isn't something you can turn on seconds before you walk into the audition room. People like Ruben or Kelly

Kobe Bryant finished with 49 points and 10 assists- one shy of his career playoff high in both categories. Tonight, the way he was going, we probably could have put 10 people on the court and probably wouldn't have been able to stop him, said Nuggets star Allen Iverson , who wasn't bad himself, getting 31 points and six assists. Aaron Rodgers was all smiles yesterday as a guest on "Late Show with David Letterman ." David Letterman handed Aaron Rodgers his WWE championship belt and even caught a pass across the stage from the Super Bowl MVP. There must be a lot of Wisconsin people out there, Aaron Rodgers said as his eyes scanned the crowd, which was met with cheers from the probable Packer backers in attendance. David Letterman asked a series of light-hearted questions, with Aaron Rodgers willingly playing along.
